radiographic_examinations.findings: Pleural calcifications and plaques; diffuse, bilateral peripheral reticular opacities, more prominent in the lower lobes.
New bilateral pulmonary opacities thought to represent multifocal pneumonia or edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive lower-lobe consolidation and ground-glass opacities superimposed on previously described findings.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomographic (CT) scans of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple patchy ground-glass opacities and consolidation in gravity-dependent areas of the lungs; mild pulmonary edema; chronic lung and pleural changes consistent with asbestosis; thyroid nodules; mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: All findings had been present on previous examinations.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the neck and thorax
radiographic_examinations.findings: Hypodensity in the right thyroid gland; thickening and irregularity of the esophagus; right hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy up to 2.1 cm in diameter; multiple small, low-attenuation lesions in the liver; perihepatic ascites; circumferential thickening of the gallbladder wall.

Pleural findings seen previously; at least four solid hepatic lesions (up to 2.9 cm in diameter); hypodensities in segment 8 thought to represent thrombosed intrahepatic branches of the right portal vein.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Multiple low-attenuation lesions had not been present previously.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal swallowing mechanism; abnormal mucosal pattern of the esophagus, with multiple reticulations and a cobblestone appearance; longitudinal muscular hypertrophy.
